description: An illustration of a "hole" in disc golf, consisting of a ring at the top of a pole with seven chains hanging from the ring's bottom that converge halfway down the pole; a wire basket sits below the bottom of the chains. A red frisbee flies toward the target. There is a red flag with the number 1 printed in the center, marking this target as the first hole of a disc golf course. There are various green triangles below the target representing tufts of grass.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
